intro: Galium tinctorium var. submontanum, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its historical use in dyeing fabrics and as a medicinal herb highlights its botanical and cultural significance.
